Description: Handle plate of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater with handle scar; underside: reserved save for streaky black beside handle scar and on one edge; top: black around edges; black-figure decoration consisting of confronted sphinxes (left sphinx well preserved; added red on wing and thigh and added white on face, head and forepaws lost; of second sphinx only chest with added red remaining); two drill holes for clay analysis on underside of plate.
Dimensions: Thickness: 1.30 centimetres (about (front edge of handle plate))
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 279, no. B236)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0153) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 102, pl. XII, no. 5)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
